title: Drawing, "Five Studies of New England autumn landscapes  (probably Vermont)", October 1865
medium: Brush and oil paint, graphite on paperboard
inscribed: Upper left sketch inscribed in brush and brown oil paint, lower right:  Oct. 65; center sketch, lower right:  Oct/65; upper right sketch in brush and red oil paint, lower right:  Oct 65; lower right sketch in brush and brown oil paint, lower right:  Oct 65 [see curatorial remarks]
description: Five separate studies float on creamy ground.  Upper row center:  a tree with red leaves stands in center of meadow with two grazing cows at lower left and green trees in background.  The lateral right study shows group of trees with cows grazing lower right; left study,a group of trees.  On lower half of sheet, at left, a group of trees in autumn color; at right, a hill sloping down to right behind which is a valley and a hill rising up in rear.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Five Studies of New England autumn landscapes  (probably Vermont)", October 1865.
October 1865. Brush and oil paint, graphite on paperboard. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-764.
